results.title: Running on empty
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Griffin Dunne, Amy Robinson and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: An absorbing film about a pair of anti-Vietnam activists (Judd Hirsch and Christine Lahti) who have been in hiding from the FBI for over fifteen years. Still committed to their radical ideals, the couple have to face a crisis of conscience when their talented oldest son (River Phoenix) begins to dream about attending music college and leaving behind his life on the run. This under-rated film is an extremely clear-headed portrayal of how the the politics of the Vietnam era still affects the social relationships of contemporary America. One of the most remarkable features of this film is the compassionate tone it extends across the generations. This complex and intelligent film is a film that refuses the easy revisionist moralism of Kasdan’s “The Big Chill”. Made in a decade notable for computer generated whimsy, this very adult Hollywood film is a treasure.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sidney Lumet, Griffin Dunne, Amy Robinson and Lorimar Film Entertainment

results.title: Running on empty
results.creator_credit: John Clark, Mark Egerton, Pom Oliver and Film Corporation of Western Australia
results.brief_description: A young man, Mike, has an obsession with cars and someone else’s girlfriend. The film concentrates on his struggle to win her, and survive the challenge of her mean boyfriend to a series of illegal street races. Cast includes Deborah Conway, Max Cullen and Richard Moir.

results.title: Running high: a story of pain and joy ...
results.creator_credit: Gus Howard and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Novices and champions prepare for, and run the 1983 Festival City Marathon. Robert de Castella intersperses candid interviews with his marathon running philosophy and techniques. Discusses the exhilaration of personal improvement, the disappointment of hitting the wall and the reasons behind the increasing popularity of running throughout the world.

results.title: Runner
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In an age when most North American boys have their eyes on a car, there are a few who choose the older ideal of fleetness of foot. Such a one is Bruce Kidd, Toronto long-distance runner, winner of national and international honors. Oblivious of the clapping crowds and the flash of cameras, he knows full well that in the long run it is the cold stopwatch that tells the truth. Commentary written by W. H. Auden.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Owen, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Runaway bride
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Tom Rosenberg, Scott Kroopf, Ted Field, Robert W. Cort, Touchstone Pictures, Lakeshore Entertainment and Interscope Commmunication
results.brief_description: Richard Gere is Ike Graham, a big-city newspaper columnist who causes an uproar with an unflattering and wildly erroneous story about small-town girl Maggie Carpenter. Julia Roberts is Maggie, whose reputation for leaving prospective husbands at the altar has made her a local legend. Gere is assigned by his editor (Hector Elizondo) to write a follow-up story on Maggie, and he tracks her down to her home town in Maryland where she is spending time with her family and preparing to give marriage another try. While Ike plans to prove he was right about Maggie, and Maggie plans to even the score with Ike, nothing prepares them for the sparks that fly when they meet! Cast also includes Joan Cusack, Rita Wilson, Paul Dooley, Christopher Meloni.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Garry Marshall, Tom Rosenberg, Scott Kroopf, Ted Field, Robert W. Cort, Touchstone Pictures, Lakeshore Entertainment and Interscope Commmunication

results.title: Run Rebecca Run (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, Brendon Lunney and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: When the local newspaper offers a fully equipped bicycle to the young person submitting the best photograph of their pet with a suitable caption, Rebecca Porter quickly goes into the National Park with her cockatoo, Fancy. The photographic expedition goes well until a sandbank, on which she is posing Fancy, is threatened by the rapidly rising tide. While she is stranded, she meets Manuel, a ship’s deserter, who faces deportation. When Rebecca is eventually rescued, it is too late to enter the competition.

results.title: Run for our rights
results.material_description: Digital screen recording of @aiww's instagram feed
results.brief_description: Chinese artist Ai Wei Wei is campaigning against threats to journalistic free speech by encouraging others to post videos of themselves “running for our rights”. Australian journalist Julian Assange gave Ai Wei Wei a treadmill he used while living at the Ecuadorian Embassy in London. Assange faces potential extradition and prison in America for publishing US government documents on Wikileaks.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Chinese artist Ai Wei Wei is campaigning against threats to journalistic free speech by encouraging others to post videos of themselves “running for our rights”. Australian journalist Julian Assange gave Ai Wei Wei a treadmill he used while living at the Ecuadorian Embassy in London. Assange faces potential extradition and prison in America for publishing US government documents on Wikileaks.
description_for_label: Chinese artist Ai Wei Wei is campaigning against threats to journalistic free speech by encouraging others to post videos of themselves “running for our rights”. Australian journalist Julian Assange gave Ai Wei Wei a treadmill he used while living at the Ecuadorian Embassy in London. Assange faces potential extradition and prison in America for publishing US government documents on Wikileaks.

results.title: Round the twist: the gum-leaf war
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Dreaming that she has a huge nose, Linda takes her problems to Aunt Tuneless’ shack in the mountains where a war is in progress. People can inflict their own ailments on others by playing the gum leaves from a twisted tree.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Round the twist: skeleton on the dunny
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When the Twists move from the city to live in an old lighthouse, they discover that the outside dunny is haunted. One stormy night they decide to have a showdown with a very flushed ghost.

results.title: Round the twist: spaghetti pig out
results.creator_credit: Paul Jennings, Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Chaos reigns after a bolt of lightning hits the video remote control - it works on people! Pause, rewind and fast-forward have amusing consequences, particularly at the spaghetti eating competition.
